content: this is a summary of a civil case that took place in the panevėžys district court the court resolved a matrimonial property case and decided to dissolve the marriage between the applicant and the defendant the court divided the movable and immovable properties between the parties with the applicant receiving a ½ share of the apartment basement and the defendant receiving a ½ share of the apartment basement plot of land and multiple buildings and structures the defendant was also ordered to pay the applicant a sum of €500 the court discussed various aspects related to the fulfillment of obligations by spouses in relation to matrimonial property including the determination of asset values and deviation from equal shares the court also addressed the joint liability of the parties for a bank loan and other financial obligations the court allowed the action and counterclaim of both parties and annulled the marriage due to the fault of both spouses the court ordered the payment of costs and stamp duty with the defendant being responsible for paying certain costs to the applicant and the state
